Title: Enhancing Human-in-the-Loop Adaptive Systems through Digital Twins and VR Interfaces
Authors: Enes Yigitbas, Kadir Karakaya, Ivan Jovanovikj, G. Engels
Venue: International Symposium on Software Engineering for Adaptive and Self-Managing Systems
Abstract summary: The paper explores using digital twins and VR interfaces to enhance transparency and controllability in human-in-the-loop adaptive systems.

Title: Improving Human-Machine Interaction with a Digital Twin
Authors: Jasper Wilhelm, Thies Beinke, M. Freitag
Abstract summary: A digital twin with adaptive automation allows combining human and machine strengths in a semi-autonomous system.

Title: Human Digital Twin—Enabling Human-Agents Collaboration
Venue: 2021 4th International Conference on Intelligent Robotics and Control Engineering (IRCE)
Abstract summary: Human Digital Twins can enable consistent human-agent interaction in smart environments by observing and learning about human interaction patterns.

Title: The Role of Multi-Agents in Digital Twin Implementation: Short Survey
Abstract summary: The paper explores the role of multi-agent systems in implementing digital twins, but does not discuss limitations for human-in-the-loop systems.

Title: Human Digital Twin: Enabling Human-Multi Smart Machines Collaboration
Abstract summary: The paper introduces the concept of a Human Digital Twin to align multiple smart machines supporting a human with the human's objectives.

Title: ANSR-DT: An Adaptive Neuro-Symbolic Learning and Reasoning Framework for Digital Twins
Authors: Safayat Bin Hakim, Muhammad Adil, Alvaro Velasquez, Houbing Herbert Song
Abstract summary: ANSR-DT is an adaptive neuro-symbolic learning framework for digital twins that combines pattern recognition, reinforcement learning, and symbolic reasoning, but challenges remain in integrating symbolic rules in complex environments.

Title: Toward Digital Twins for Human-in-the-loop Systems: A Framework for Workload Management and Burnout Prevention in Healthcare Systems
Authors: Md Doulotuzzaman Xames, Taylan G. Topcu
Venue: 2023 IEEE 3rd International Conference on Digital Twins and Parallel Intelligence (DTPI)
Abstract summary: The paper proposes a framework for using digital twins to manage workload and prevent burnout in human-in-the-loop healthcare systems.

Title: Human Digital Twins: Two-Layer Machine Learning Architecture for Intelligent Human-Machine Collaboration
Venue: International Conference on Intelligent Human Systems Integration
Abstract summary: A two-layer machine learning architecture for human digital twins enables adaptive human-machine collaboration in complex digital systems.
